This is a totally different world

Olá!! Here we are, after more than a week living in Mozambique and we can say we like it here. We will (estarem b’e aqui). Even if, like the tittle of the post says, this is a totally different world, we will be happy here!

Where to start. On of the first things we’ve noticed here is the pase, the rythem, everything is kind of slower, people are not in a rush, they know how to wait and how to do nothing. This is really chocking, coming form a society where we are always running from one thing to another, with a super long to do list, with no time to relax just work. I feel like here people walk slower, they talk slower, they take their time to ask you how are you and how is your family before asking you whatever they need, … In one hand is kind of annoying because I feel like, come on, but at the same time is kind of nice and it helps us appreciate and take our time too to absorve all this. I think in the end it’s a good thing to learn, to slow down.

The weather is one of the big things that effects us here too. We are currently in spring. The temperatures goes from around 32℃ (90°F) during the day to 21℃ (70°F) at night lately. There has been some really hot days when it’s already humid and nasty at 10 in the morning, but then it normally cools down in the evening and that’s kind of nice. There has been some rainy days too, where it’s raining almost all day but it’s nice because when it stops the temperature it’s really nice out.

The sunrise now is at 4:50 in the morning! 4:50 people!! That means that more then one day we are up at 5 am, because our baby doesn’t know that she should still be sleeping, because it’s bright outside and our courtains are not .. enough!

Date

November 26, 2016

Author

Coloma Farré
